Package org.jmisb.api.klv.st0102.localset

Class SecurityMetadataLocalSet.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jmisb.api.klv.st0102.localset.SecurityMetadataLocalSet.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    SecurityMetadataLocalSet
    public static class SecurityMetadataLocalSet.Builder
extends Object
    Builder class for SecurityMetadataLocalSet objects.

    This class is meant to be used with a set of chained method calls, as shown in this example: 

     
 SecurityMetadataLocalSet fullMessage = new SecurityMetadataLocalSet.Builder(Classification.UNCLASSIFIED)
 .ccMethod(CountryCodingMethod.ISO3166_THREE_LETTER)
 .classifyingCountry("//USA")
 .caveats("FOUO")
 .ocMethod(CountryCodingMethod.ISO3166_TWO_LETTER)
 .objectCountryCodes("US;CA")
 .version(12)
 .build();

    • Constructor Detail

      • Builder

        public Builder​(Classification classification)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        classification - the classification to use in this SecurityMetadataLocalSet

    • Method Detail

      • ccMethod

        public SecurityMetadataLocalSet.Builder ccMethod​(CountryCodingMethod value)
        Coding method for Classifying Country and Releasing Instructions.

        This indicates how the classifyingCountry and releasingInstructions are to be interpreted.

        This item is required for the security local set to be valid. If it is not provided, CountryCodingMethod.GENC_TWO_LETTER will be used as a default value.

        Consider setting ccmDate to indicate a specific version of the coding method.

        Parameters:
        value - the country coding method
        Returns:
        instance of this Builder, to support method chaining.

      • classifyingCountry

        public SecurityMetadataLocalSet.Builder classifyingCountry​(String value)
        The classifying country.

        This specifies which country classified the data (or possibly which country's security rules / guidance are being used for the classification). The value is the country code preceded by //. For example, if the ccMethod is ISO3166_THREE_LETTER, then Australia would be represented as "//AUS".

        This item is required for the security local set to be valid. There is no default value, and the build() will fail if it is not provided.

        Parameters:
        value - the country code (including the required "//" part).
        Returns:
        instance of this Builder, to support method chaining.

      • sciShiInfo

        public SecurityMetadataLocalSet.Builder sciShiInfo​(String value)
        Security Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) / Special Handling Instructions (SHI) information.

        When special handling instructions or compartmented information are used, Motion Imagery Data shall contain the Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) / Special Handling Instructions (SHI) metadata element. When used, SCI/SHI digraphs, trigraphs, or compartment names shall be added identifying a single or a combination of special handling instructions.

        A single entry shall be ended with a double forward slash “//”.

        Multiple digraphs, trigraphs, or compartment names shall be separated by a single forward slash “/”.

        Multiple digraphs, trigraphs, or compartment names shall be ended with a double forward slash “//”.

        Parameters:
        value - the SCI / SHI information, including the ending double forward slash and any single forward slash separators.
        Returns:
        instance of this Builder, to support method chaining.

      • caveats

        public SecurityMetadataLocalSet.Builder caveats​(String value)
        Security Caveats.

        The Caveats metadata element represents pertinent caveats (or code words) from each category of the appropriate security entity register. Entries in this field may be abbreviated or spelled out as free text entries.

        Value is the caveat text or abbreviation. For example, if the Motion Imagery was considered Unclassified, For Official Use Only, the value might be: "FOUO".

        Parameters:
        value - the caveat text or abbreviation
        Returns:
        instance of this Builder, to support method chaining.

      • releasingInstructions

        public SecurityMetadataLocalSet.Builder releasingInstructions​(String value)
        The countries that the motion imagery data is releasable to.

        The Releasing Instructions metadata element contains a list of country codes to indicate the countries to which the Motion Imagery Data is releasable.

        Value is the country codes for those countries (as specified in the classifyingCountry(String value) separated by spaces. For example, if the CountryCodingMethod is ISO3166_THREE_LETTER, then release to Canada and the United States would be represented as "CAN USA".

        This item is required if releasing instructions are required.

        Parameters:
        value - the space separated list of country codes.
        Returns:
        instance of this Builder, to support method chaining.

      • classifiedBy

        public SecurityMetadataLocalSet.Builder classifiedBy​(String value)
        Classified By.

        The Classified By metadata element identifies the name and type of authority used to classify the Motion Imagery Data. The metadata element is free text and can contain either the original classification authority name and position or personal identifier, or the title of the document or security classification guide used to classify the data.

        An example might be "Mark W. Ewing, ODNI Chief Management Officer").

        Parameters:
        value - the classified by text
        Returns:
        instance of this Builder, to support method chaining.

      • derivedFrom

        public SecurityMetadataLocalSet.Builder derivedFrom​(String value)
        Derived From.

        The Derived From metadata element contains information about the original source of data from which the classification was derived. The metadata element is free text.

        Value is the derivative source text. For example, if the classification was derived from multiple sources, it could be shown as "Multiple Sources".

        Parameters:
        value - the derived from text
        Returns:
        instance of this Builder, to support method chaining.

      • classificationReason

        public SecurityMetadataLocalSet.Builder classificationReason​(String value)
        Classification Reason.

        The Classification Reason metadata element contains the reason for classification or a citation from a document. The metadata element is free text.

        For example, if the classification reason is in section 1.4(c), it could be shown as "1.4(c)".

        Parameters:
        value - the classification reason or citation
        Returns:
        instance of this Builder, to support method chaining.

      • declassificationDate

        public SecurityMetadataLocalSet.Builder declassificationDate​(LocalDate value)
        Declassification Date.

        The Declassification Date metadata element provides a date when the classified material may be automatically declassified.

        Parameters:
        value - the declassification date
        Returns:
        instance of this Builder, to support method chaining.

      • markingSystem

        public SecurityMetadataLocalSet.Builder markingSystem​(String value)
        Classification and Marking System.

        The Classification and Marking System metadata element identifies the classification or marking system used in the Security Metadata set as determined by the appropriate security entity for the country originating the data. This is free text.

        Parameters:
        value - text describing or identifying the classification and marking system
        Returns:
        instance of this Builder, to support method chaining.

      • ocMethod

        public SecurityMetadataLocalSet.Builder ocMethod​(CountryCodingMethod value)
        Object Country Coding Method.

        The Object Country Coding Method metadata element identifies the coding method for the objectCountryCodes metadata. This element allows use of GEC two-letter or four-letter alphabetic country code (legacy systems only); ISO-3166 two-letter, three-letter, or three-digit numeric; STANAG 1059 two-letter or three-letter codes; and GENC two-letter, three-letter, three-digit numeric or administrative subdivisions.

        This item is required for the local set to be valid. If it is not provided, CountryCodingMethod.GENC_TWO_LETTER will be used as a default value.

        Parameters:
        value - the country coding method to be used for object country codes
        Returns:
        instance of this Builder, to support method chaining.

      • objectCountryCodes

        public SecurityMetadataLocalSet.Builder objectCountryCodes​(String value)
        Object Country Codes.

        The Object Country Codes metadata element contains a value identifying the country or countries that are the object of the Motion Imagery Data.

        Multiple Object Country Codes shall be separated by a semi-colon “;” (no spaces).

        The object country code of the geographic region lying under the center of the image frame shall populate the Object Country Code metadata element. The object country codes of other represented geographic regions may be included in addition to the country code of the geographic region under the center of the image frame.

        This item is required for the security local set to be valid. There is no default value, and the build() will fail if it is not provided.

        Parameters:
        value - the country code, or codes separated with semi-colon characters
        Returns:
        instance of this Builder, to support method chaining.

      • classificationComments

        public SecurityMetadataLocalSet.Builder classificationComments​(String value)
        Classification Comments.

        The Classification Comments metadata element allows for security related comments and format changes necessary in the future. This field may be used in addition to those required by appropriate security entity and is optional.

        The Classification Comments metadata element shall only be used to convey non-essential security-related information.

        Parameters:
        value - free text classification comments
        Returns:
        instance of this Builder, to support method chaining.

      • version

        public SecurityMetadataLocalSet.Builder version​(int value)
        Version of Security Metadata Standard.

        The Version metadata element indicates the version number of MISB ST 0102 referenced. For example, ST 0102.12 would have the value 12.

        SecurityMetadataConstants.ST_VERSION_NUMBER will provide the current version supported by jMISB.

        This value is required for the local set to be valid, and the value of SecurityMetadataConstants.ST_VERSION_NUMBER will be used as a default value if it is not provided.

        Parameters:
        value - the version number of ST 0102 document
        Returns:
        instance of this Builder, to support method chaining.

      • ccmDate

        public SecurityMetadataLocalSet.Builder ccmDate​(LocalDate value)
        Country Coding Method Version Date.

        This metadata item provides the effective date (promulgation date) of the source (FIPS 10-4, ISO 3166, GENC, or STANAG 1059) used for the Classifying Country and Releasing Instructions Country Coding Method. As ISO 3166 is updated by dated circulars, not by version revision, the ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DD formatted date is used. The valid country codes (and the corresponding meanings) can vary between versions of those coding methods, so this metadata item can be used to identify the exact version of the coding method.

        Parameters:
        value - the effective date of the Country Coding Method source document.
        Returns:
        instance of this Builder, to support method chaining.

      • ocmDate

        public SecurityMetadataLocalSet.Builder ocmDate​(LocalDate value)
        Object Country Coding Method Version Date.

        This metadata item provides the effective date (promulgation date) of the source (FIPS 10-4, ISO 3166, GENC, or STANAG 1059) used for the Object Country Coding Method. As ISO 3166 is updated by dated circulars, not by version revision, the ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DD formatted date is used. The valid country codes (and the corresponding meanings) can vary between versions of those coding methods, so this metadata item can be used to identify the exact version of the coding method.

        Parameters:
        value - the effective date of the Country Coding Method source document.
        Returns:
        instance of this Builder, to support method chaining.

      • build

        public SecurityMetadataLocalSet build()
        Build the security local set.

        This takes the security information specified in the previous Builder calls and builds a @@link SecurityMetadataLocalSet}, filling in any default values.

        Returns:
        the resulting local set.
